data.title: Remove/delay/wait TD clone-function in crates
data.body:
Hi.

Most of the games in TD are played with crates off. That is because the players say it will end the game early.. Even when we play 3 vs 3... When you then loose you construction yard, often all hope is lost. 
Can the "clone units" have 5-10 min waiting time? Can crates wait before they arrive? Can anything be done? At least the player AoA want a change in crates, and he play TD alot. 
please help us find a way to make players use it again...

data.title: Safer country lookup
data.body: Avoid returning a null string. Fixes #8016.

data.title: Added unit repair via order button with optional Carryall transport
data.body:
Carryalls are supposed to be able to carry units back to the repair pad.
This PR enables this:
![](http://i.imgur.com/U04lNeC.gif)

You can also see a better example ingame with [this replay](https://www.dropbox.com/s/8qzyh3xmvj0c3dp/OpenRA-2015-04-28T180905Z.orarep). (Still, don't forget to test yourselves :P )
The replay is just short of 4 minutes long and shows a group of units being transported for repair. After that a quick verification that carryall-harvester interaction hasn't changed.

data.title: Update widget mouseover when scrolling panels.
data.body:
The new map editor remains blocked by #8017, so here's another chunk that can be reviewed in parallel.

This fixes a long-standing bug where scrolling a scrollpanel does not update the mouseover region beneath it.  A simple repro/fix case is to mouse-over a game in the server browser, and then scroll the panel with the mousewheel.  The highlighted game will now correctly change.

data.title: Separate terrain geometry visualization from DevMode.
data.body:
The new map editor remains blocked by #8017, so here's another chunk that can be reviewed in parallel.

This moves the terrain geometry visualization toggle from DevMode onto the layer trait itself, and gives it its own â€œterrainoverlay" console command that can be used in places where the player doesn't have an associated player actor (observers/replays and the editor).

data.title: Fixes blue tiberium not appearing in legacy editor (TD)
data.body:
The `EditorSprite` for the external editor looks for a filename rather than a sequence name, but since sequence names and filenames for blue tiberium don't match, it doesn't show up in the editor. Additionally, even if it did, the editor cannot handle FixedColorPalette, so rtib1.\* would show up with the default "GDI" remap color, rather than blue.

Adding a bti1.shp to the bits folder that uses blue colors from the palette instead of remap fixes both issues.

data.title: Add Cargo descriptions.
Add HealsPassengers and change UnloadCargo to take an actor reference (or IEnumerable<Actor>).

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body:
Makes use of new `Cargo::UnloadSpecific` to unload a specific passenger.
The English **TODO** still needs to be done.

Fulfills `Hospital (hurt inf goes in, exits healed)` from #7874.

Currently heals all actors simultaneously, do we want a queue instead (dependent on input order or damage level)?

Depends on #8052.

data.title: Improve rendering performance
data.body:
Reuse information generated in previous renders where possible, to reduce the amount of new work to be done each frame.

This PR caches rendering information in two ways:
- A VertexCache class which allows calculated vertices to be reused across frames. Resources, smudges and buildable terrain benefit from this as they represent large regions that don't change often.
- The shroud was previously employing some manual vertex caching of its own, but still had to rebuild vertex buffers every frame. It now avoids this costly rebuild by maintaining its own vertex buffers.

The VertexCache changes reduce CPU time spent in rendering these parts of the terrain from about 6% to 5%.

The shroud vertex buffers reduce CPU time spent rendering the shroud from about 12% to 3%.

Testing wise, I would recommend checking that shroud, resources, smudges and buildable terrain work as expected across all the mods. You should not notice any changes in the visuals.

data.title: added nod4b
data.body: So here is the next mission. Happy testing...

data.title: Updated Travis CI configuration to enforce Mono 3
data.body: as advised in https://github.com/travis-ci/travis-ci/issues/3776 so our builds stop erroring.

data.title: Fix missing infantry in the legacy editor
data.body:
The editor is looking for actor types that implement ILegacyEditorRender, but infantry units don't anymore since #7638.

This moves ILegacyEditorRender to the root of the Render\* inheritance tree, so that all actor types have access to it.

data.title: Use WithProductionDoorOverlay on fake weap
data.body: At current bleed trying to place a fake weap crashes the game.

data.title: Retire RenderFlare and WithFire traits
data.body:
This is just another step toward making use of #7865.

This combines `RenderFlare` and `WithFire` in a single `WithSpriteBody` trait, which can hopefully later be used for some of `DeployToUpgrade`'s use cases.

Nothing should change ingame.
Reviewing tip:
- The RA mission **allies-01** is a very easy way to test that the oil derrick husks (which are the only use-case for `WithFire`) still look OK.
- The RA mission **soviet-01** is a very easy way to test that the Flare actor (which is the only use-case for `RenderFlare` (imagine that)) still looks OK.

**Edit:**

> [15:38] <+pchote> my use case is for this to replace _all_ the Render\* traits
> [15:38] <+pchote> except RenderSprites, of course

Eventually, but not now.

data.title: Polish TS war factories.
data.body: Fixes the produced actors clipping through the factory.

data.title: cant undeploy a construction conyard
data.body:
okay , here is the deal ... 

i have experienced in the new release (1 time so far) , that i couldnt undeploy a construction conyard (my 2nd one to be precise) ... all i know is , it was under attack , and ive tried to undeploy during the attack ... 

later on , ive investigated the replay , but couldnt find any indicator ... started a debug-game and tried various things to reproduce it again ... but it didnt show up again .... 

within 2 days , several people reported this problem in the lobby ... 

![undeploy](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9139965/7339121/4f86e2a2-ec63-11e4-87c6-a071276d9f81.png)

also @TheRaffy told me , that he experienced this 

some people (@pchote , @penev92 ) say that this is a old bug , but since we have our new release this appears to be more common now , though still occasionally  ... 

here is my replay where it happend on HaosRidge @ 10:34 - 10:55 ... in the "Top Left corner" ... im the light-blue player called "Wasa" : 

https://www.dropbox.com/s/h6ikq2ai21e3ztz/undeploy%20bug%20micro.orarep?dl=0

![undeployyyyyyyyy](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9139965/7339153/848f161c-ec64-11e4-8ff5-82038b38f718.png)

data.title: TD levelup (+1 Rank) and chevron art use wrong palette
data.body: The shps were apparently just copied over from RA, we need to either a) add the RA palette to the TD mod and use that, or convert the shps to TD's own palette.

data.body: For TS/RA2 compatibility.

data.body: instead of directly onto the GitHub CDN.

data.title: libSDL2.dylib and liblua.5.1.dylib contents incorrect on fetching dependencies
data.body: Fetching dependencies for MAC OS X, the libSDL2.dylib and liblua.5.1.dylibis is incorrect. The contents of the file is actually a redirect. `You are being redirected.` and causes System.DllNotFoundException: libSDL2.dylib

data.title: DevEnableTech does not work properly in TD.
data.body:
It will only allow you to build the items of your faction (i.e., GDI will not be able to build Nod structures).

Although, it does allow you to build the other faction's conyard, which might be enough for testing?

data.title: Some chrome logic cleanups
data.body:
Some cleanups in preparation for the new map editor:
- Allow a widget to define multiple Logic objects.
- Split the order button logics from the menu opening logic.
- Separate the ingame perf graphs into their own trees.

data.title: Music plays for one track, then doesn't continue
data.body:
In RA the music starts to play on the splash screen and continues when you are ingame. Once the first track finishes however, it does not continue to play the rest of the tracks.

Release 20150424
Ubuntu 14.10

data.title: Fixed "building online" played by power off and vice versa on Tiberian Sun
data.body: Building offline/online have been twisted. A regression from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7854.

data.body:
that way it'd be possible to play asymmetrical warfare games against a higher-equipped AI enemy, or to handicap stronger players in online games

data.title: TD: AI should not build helipad when tech level = low
data.body:
when tech level is set to "low" the helipad may only be used to build transport helicopters but the AI does not use them - since it is not possible to build Apaches/Orcas the AI should not attempt to build helipads and use the resources elsewhere
